story.author: Yolanda Burrows
story.headline: Breaking - Harrison Street Design to Close Down Stores in UK
story.subheading: The furnishings company has announced it will be closing all stores across the UK, and concentrate operations on Central and Eastern Europe.

article.p: The furnishings giant has been suffering losses in the past 3 years, according to internal sources. However, the news came as a surprise for the industry. Harrison Street Design is a company with tradition in the UK and has recently celebrated 170 years since its establishment in the country. What happened?

'We're very sorry to have to exit the UK market, but we have carefully analysed and considered this move. It is in the best interests of the company. We will be targeting Central and Eastern Europe, as the market there is thriving. We have already offered our employees either generous termination packages or the opportunity to move with us.', has declared Edward Walker, spokesperson for HSD.
It is expected that all Harrison Street Design stores will be closed by the end of the year.
